alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 11:47PM EDT until June 27 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Lee County in central South Carolina... East central Lexington County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Sumter County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Richland County in central South Carolina... Southwestern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 1230 AM EDT. * At 1146 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Woodfield, or over Columbia, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, Dentsville, Shaw Air Base, McEntire Air Base, South Sumter, St. Andrews, Arcadia Lakes, Oakland, Mulberry, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, Fort Jackson, Five Points and Villages at Sandhill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 2 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 68 and 90. Interstate 26 near mile marker 112. Interstate 77 between mile markers 6 and 24. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows.
